attributes.action: Help from the NHS to provide more mental health support for people aged 16-18.
attributes.background: The NHS have many adolescent services but long waiting lists mean that support is unavailable when people most critically need it. When people reach 17, they no longer fit the criteria for an adolescent patient, but don't fit in the age range for adult services, so they are left without support.
attributes.additional_details: Being left to find private services at the age of 17 can be very difficult for families as a result of the very high prices. The cost of services can prevent these people from getting the support they need. This time without care can be very detrimental to a young person with poor mental health, so therefore the gap between adolescent and adult services needs to be filled.

attributes.action: Defer invocation of Article 50 until DJ Trump and M Pence have left office.
attributes.background: At a time of unprecented instability in the United States of America we need to stand shoulder to shoulder with our European allies in order to promote and maintain global stability and democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: Invoking article 50 is likely to destabilise our economy at a time of heightened global threat. Leaving the EU at this time will render us highly dependent on the United States of America. Under the leadership of Donald Trump and/or Mike Pence we cannot assume that our national interest will be best served by this alliance.

attributes.action: Service charges & tips should be given to staff automatically by law
attributes.background:
The TV chef Michel Roux Jr has admitted his Michelin-starred Le Gavroche restaurant keeps 100% of the service charge added to bills instead of distributing the cash to staff in addition to their pay.

The government ran a consultation this summer but no law has been passed so far.

attributes.action: Lower the amount of signatures needed for discussion in parliament to 25000
attributes.background: The minimum signatures required for discussion in parliament is too high at 100,000

attributes.action: Scrap 'killer' diesel cars and compensate owners misled by Government advice.
attributes.background:
From 2001-2015 the UK public were encouraged by Government to buy diesel cars as they were better for the environment.
Now, those cars might be banned because of an estimated 23,500 premature deaths a year.
A scrappage scheme would protect health & compensate well-meaning owners who were misled.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Chancellor reduced VED in 2001 for cars with low CO2 emissions, and the scrappage scheme of 2009, the UK public were encouraged to buy ‘cleaner diesels’.

In 2015 Lord Drayson said that Government "made a mistake" in encouraging diesel ownership.

We need these vehicles off our roads, but well-intentioned current owners were badly misled by the Government, and will suffer financially, being unable to sell their vehicles, or use them freely due to proposals to limit their use.

attributes.action: Upon leaving the EU, immediately pay £350 million per week to the NHS.
attributes.background: It is widely held that to ignore the Referendum vote  would be a dereliction of democracy. Equally derelict would be to ignore the rest of the deal, garishly displayed on the Leavers' bus. To respect part of the deal and to ignore the rest is fraudulent. We want hypothecated inflation-adjusted funds
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=the+leave+bus&biw=1366&bih=565&tbm=isch&imgil=rUuQGgKEqz2V6M%253A%253BAuHiIFjCc5DKkM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.itv.com%25252Fnews%25252Fwestcountry%25252Fstory%25252F2016-05-11%25252Feu-referendum-vote-leave-campaign-gets-underway-in-cornwall%25252F&source=iu&pf=m&fir=rUuQGgKEqz2V6M%253A%252CAuHiIFjCc5DKkM%252C_&usg=__pVjQA6MrJ7G5fZBt4Ff6UawN9_E%3D&ved=0ahUKEwjLjua7o_bRAhVQF8AKHfc5BmUQyjcIJQ&ei=zLKVWMt40K6ABvfzmKgG#imgrc=Jr4HD7qgUDrKKM:

attributes.action: Give all airfields statutory protection as Valuable Habitats for flora & fauna
attributes.background:
Airfields are under threat for development for housing
Airfields provide havens for flora and fauna as they are never ploughed or sprayed with chemicals - occasional aircraft movement has little effect on plants animals & reptiles
Airfields provide an open space amenity for local people
attributes.additional_details: Airfields are being closed by developers destroying significant areas of natural habitat within airfield boundaries. All airfields should be reclassified as "Valuable Habitats" and given protected status to save rare plants, animals, reptiles, insects and invertebrates under The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2010

attributes.action: Decrease the price of TV licence go down rather than increase it
attributes.background: A TV licence currently costs £145.50 which this is being increased to £147. Just to watch TV. This is outrageous and it should not be that price to start with. Never mind increasing it.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/media/2017/mar/01/television-licence-fee-increases-147

attributes.action: Bring back licences for businesses wanting to sell tobacco related products.
attributes.background: At this time there is no regulation for the selling of tobacco related products which is, in my opinion, 'feeding' the sales of illicit goods.  I would like to see the Government bring back licencing to work the same way as an alcohol licence with the decision process being through local councils.

attributes.action: change the criteria for disabled persons bus passes and include autism
attributes.background: I'm campaigning for a change in policy for disabled bus passes as I do strongly agree people with autism should be able to apply for one yet the department for transport classes autism as a learning disability which people with autism can some times have a learning disability but not all
attributes.additional_details: The Department for transport should change there criteria to include autism as not everyone with autism has a learning disability

attributes.action: Stop The Franco-British military pact as it was not debated in Parliament
attributes.background: The Franco-British military pact was not debated in Parliament and the public was not invited to debate the issue. This pact was set up by David Cameron in 2010.

attributes.action: Do not cut the number of visas for international students coming to the UK.
attributes.background: The Home office is considering plans to cut the number of visas granted to overseas students by nearly half, slashing the current 300,000 to 170,000 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Besides denying students an opportunity to study at UK universities, this move will cost the UK economy (Universities UK puts non-EU student contributions to UK GDP at £9b in 2014-15). In short this is a lose-lose measure. Students lose out. The UK loses out. And the government gains nothing substantive in its efforts to reach Conservative manifesto migration targets.

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to 3% GDP as US calls for NATO allies to do more.
attributes.background:
The US accounts for 72% of total spending in NATO. 
President-elect Donald J Trump has called for the remaining members to pay their share, 2% GDP, on defence. 
The UK has an opportunity to lead the way and break through the 2% of GDP, showing Europe that we must take the NATO alliance seriously
attributes.additional_details:
The UK pays in more to defence than any other member of NATO outside of the USA. 
By further increasing our spending to 3%, almost a match to the USA, we solidify our commitment to NATO, showing America that we support the President's call and are the USA's true friend and ally in this matter.
We will show other large NATO nations that they must do more to help the defence of the alliance.
http://www.nato.int/nato_static_fl2014/assets/pdf/pdf_2016_01/20160129_160128-pr-2016-11-eng.pdf

attributes.action: Owners of UK media should be registered to vote and pay taxes within the UK.
attributes.background: Our democracy requires balanced and accountable news media. Part of the 'fit and proper person' test for owning a significant portion of our media should be that they are eligible to vote and pay taxes, so that they, like the rest of us, are fully part of the political environment they help shape.

attributes.action: Get the NHS to recognise 'visual snow' an illness affecting thousands.
attributes.background: Visual snow means seeing what looks like static everywhere in your vision, its neurological and not a mental health illness. But unrecognised hence the name 'visual snow'. Thousands of people suffer with it and it's being ignored. Something needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details: 'Visual snow, visual static, or persistent visual snow is a transitory or persisting medical disorder in which sufferers see snow or television-like static in parts or the whole of their visual fields, constantly in all light conditions, even visible in daylight, darkness and with closed eyelids'

attributes.action: Free public travel for NHS nurses
attributes.background: NHS nurses recieve an extremely small wage and the cost of almost daily public travel can be very expensive

attributes.action: No assessments for DLA recipients when changing to PIP
attributes.background:
For people with long term disabilities that will not get better

If you have lost limbs, or an invisible disabilities such as Dyspraxia, Autism, or any disability that will never get better. ( There are loads of examples I could mention) You should not have to be reassessed for PIP.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of honey in order to fight the decline in bee populations
attributes.background: The impact that the honey industry has on bee populations is detrimental - by taking away their honey, we are depriving them of their ability to feed their young and to insulate their hives. We demand a total ban on the sale of honey in the UK to help protect our bees from extinction.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently, there has been lots of media coverage surrounding the decline in bee populations. It is no secret that if bees go extinct, we are only a couple of years behind.
Bees produce honey for two reasons – to feed their young, and to insulate their hives, therefore by taking their honey from them we are depriving them of their ability to carry out these essential survival functions. It is vital that we stop this practice for the bees' sake, for our sake and for the sake of our planet.

attributes.action: Pressure African nations to find and prosecute the buyers of Albino bodyparts
attributes.background: Albinos in East Africa are murdered,limbs cut off and sold. Few are prosecuted due to secrecy and corruption.Witch doctors make medicine from limbs for luck and wealth, superstition is rife.The market is fuelled by money.Pressurise governments of East Africa to investigate an prosecute all involved.
attributes.additional_details: The UN and EU statistics can be viewed but too long to submit. Of 74 murders only 4 prosecutions have been made since 2002 in Tanzania. Albinos are at risk of abductions, killings and mutilations in at least 27 countries.Pre-election murders go up, believed to be political superstition.In Malawi the figures are rising.International pressure is needed to make the governments openly investigate who is buying human bodyparts to prosecute them.Tell AN the UK concern of contravention of human rights.

attributes.action: End employer discrimination against people with colored hair tattoos,piercings.
attributes.background: Being made to look a certain way makes you feel discriminated against and put down, Having employers enforce their ''grooming guidelines'' to make you look ''normal'' when your CV and skills should be all that matters! discrimination against coloured hair ,piercings and tattoos  should be ILLEGAL
attributes.additional_details: Have you ever been told to dye Coloured hair that is outside the ''normal''  Blonde , brown , red , grey spectrum back to an ''acceptable'' colour. Been told to cover Visible tattoos, even tiny ones on ankles? Been made to ''tone down'' you ''look''  ? People can look how they want!  People , clients and customers , like individuality. My employer is currently trying to make me tone down my look. and I am SICK OF IT. Unless your piercings are an actual risk to your health or others at work.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties and punishments for bullies in school
attributes.background: Recently more and more children are being bullied and the incident is being posted on social media we need to show this is wrong and have stronger penalties and punishment for such behaviour to deter other people from doing it and show them this type of behaviour is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: boy 11 died due to bullying 29.9.16

attributes.action: Please make it a law for police to pursue illegal motorcyclists.
attributes.background: Police decide not to pursue illegal motorcyclists as its a risk to cause danger to the rider. But meanwhile they are causing havoc on our streets and putting innocent road users and pedestrians in danger also causing fatalities. They continue to do this because they can get away with it.

attributes.action: Fine drunks to stop the abuse of the NHS and knock-on risk to lives!
attributes.background: Introduce legislation automatically fining drunks requiring NHS ambulance/medics, to stop their NHS abuse, by turning it into the National Hang-over Service.  Ambulances and medics attending drunks are services unavailable for genuine and so more worthy emergencies, with consequential risk to life.
attributes.additional_details: Police can impose a £100 fine for “Being drunk & disorderly”. Someone so drunk requiring NHS services is defacto “drunk & disorderly” and so should be automatically fined at least £100.  Ideally introduce a new charge of “Being drunk & disorderly to the extent of requiring NHS services” with a minimum fine of £500, increased annually by £500 until the problem has been eliminated – with all monies going direct to the NHS. 31 Dec. fines should be double to fund Emergency staff double time.

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares for anyone under 18
attributes.background: Change the law to require all transport operators to offer under 18's a child fair to help financially support 16!17 year olds of the UK. We are being classed as adults when it suits financially only.
attributes.additional_details: 16/17 year olds are paid a child wage so why should we pay an adult fare for a bus or a train? Until 18, we are not treated as an adult by the law. Until we are 18, parents and doctors can legally consent medical treatment which over rules our say. It seems to be all that is cared about is getting more money. As a 16 year old preparing for the cost of insuring a car and saving for university, it is essentially unaffordable, and this is the reality for most of us.

attributes.action: Ensure Gender Inequality is taught as part of secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: Our aim is to spread awareness of the impact in which these subtle but meaningful gender stereotypes impact on women, men and children in society unwittingly. Promote high self esteem as well as to recognize the impact these portrayals have on different people.

attributes.action: Mandatory dog bite prevention in the school and preschool curriculum
attributes.background: It has become apparent with recent tragic events the current system does not stop or decrease dog bites and hospitalisation . I feel education in dog handling and bite prevention is a key area in tackling dog bites as the largest demographic is young children , many bites can be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
Bite statistics rise every year . Far too much blame is put on the breed of dog luring many owners of other breeds into a false sense of security . Many of the worlds top trainers and behaviourists such as victoria stillwell , jo rosie , nando brown , cesar millan all disagree with breed specific legislation and promote bite prevention , education and responsible dog ownership. Nearly all dog bites are preventable . 
Lets teach our children how to be safe around dogs!

attributes.action: Scrap car tax and put 1p on a litre of fuel.
attributes.background: Scrapping car tax (ved) and putting 1p on fuel will ensure everyone who drives pays the same, regardless of engine size, and no one can evade paying excise duty on fuel.

attributes.action: Require Councillors to acknowledge conflict of interest
attributes.background: A recent series of developments in my city have been widely supported by a councilor, with suggested family ties to a prominent ties to a large property developer. If true this is a conflict of interests and should be acknowledged and prevented.

attributes.action: Allow homosexual men to donate blood, if they have evidence of their HIV status.
attributes.background: Homosexual men are not allowed to donate blood due to the myth of HIV being active only in homosexual men. The law states that men who are homosexual and have had sex in the past year are not allowed to donate blood, whether or not they can prove they don't have HIV.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate a motion of no confidence in the current British Government
attributes.background: The recent foreign policy moves to remove the UK from the EU regardless of the damage it will do and the invite of Donald Trump to come to the UK on a State Visit  indicates a government that acts without care or diligence and is losing the confidence of much of the electorate each passing day.
attributes.additional_details: Much of the decisions being made by the current government appear disjointed, taken purely for short term reasons and to please only a portion of the electorate rather than for the greater good of all of the citizens of the four nations of these islands. The hasty invite to Donald Trump to meet the Queen now points to a government with an overall agenda that is ill-conceived. As such they are not fit to govern and a general election should be called.

attributes.action: Legalize CBD oil for medical use.
attributes.background: If it wasn't for CBD Oil I would still be in hospital. I've recently recovered from brain tumour surgery and CBD oil has helped me to bounce back without taking any of the pain meds given to me by doctors. CBD oil is giving me my life back slowly.
attributes.additional_details: I am setting up this petition to get CBD legalized for medical reasons, and I believe it should be given to people with many different health problems.

attributes.action: Scrap the minimum wage for under 25's and have a blanket wage for all ages
attributes.background: A school leaver with top grades vs a middle aged individual with no qualifications - who deems it fair to give the school leaver £3.20 less just because of their age? Just because they don't have as much life experience? How is it justifiable to disadvantage minors? WE are the future generation!
attributes.additional_details:
Here is the table of the minimum wages. Here you can see a difference between the lowest and highest category of ages. A huge unjustifiable £4 difference in places?

Year	    25 and over	   21 to 24	18 to 20	Under 18	Apprentice
(current rate)	£7.20	£6.95	£5.55	£4.00	£3.40
April 2017	£7.50	£7.05	£5.60	£4.05	£3.50

For example here, say a teenager who is studying at collage 4 days a week lands themselves a part time weekend job; that's 16 hours at £4. £64 a week. £256 a month. It's slavery!

attributes.action: Allocate the child maintenance service with pre paid cards
attributes.background: This should be a made legal that the receiving parent receives a pre paid card that can only be spent on items for the children! Not alcohol, nights out, cigarettes ect.. I think it's time someone done something to help the paying parent for a change as they are the one out working and providing..
attributes.additional_details: I think that many paying parents would agree with what I am trying to get across.. children need the benefit of the money, not the receiving parent! A prepaid card would be best. One that can be used in certain shops for certain items. Food, soft drinks, shoes, school clothes, toys ect.. not for use for their own pleasure! Thank you

attributes.action: Government to make Child abuse a forefront issue & change laws for offenders!
attributes.background: I believe Child abuse especially sexual is not talked about enough when it is happening way too often. The goverment & the nation need to step up & work together to clamp down on catching & ending this inhumane crime. I would like it to be a forefront issue of the government & police & laws changed.
attributes.additional_details: Whether this is done by extra funding, volunteering or campaining. It is a responsibility of every normal human being especially parents who knows this is wrong. I would also like to see laws changed for sexual offenders to receive the death penalty as there is no place for their kind in this world & any child abusers to be sterilised from having anymore. This is not the type of world I want my children to live in & I believe it is all our duty for anyone who agrees with me.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on the US as Trump threatens human rights, speech & environment
attributes.background: After a few days in office Trump has resurrected plans for oil pipelines opposed by the people, stripped funding from reproductive services, put gag orders on US government agencies and is planning to start building a border wall. Anywhere else these actions would be recognised as dictatorial.
attributes.additional_details:
Trump's actions will affect the environment to an irreversible degree, force women to fall back on dangerous abortion methods. Free speech and movement will be impeded. Please show him that the UK does not condone his dictatorial and divisive actions early on by imposing economic sanctions on the USA. If he does not get challenged things will get worse.

attributes.action: Make putting an offer on a house purchase in England legally binding.
attributes.background: Far too many people are being let down and are also suffering unnecessary costs from the fact that people can put an offer on a house they want to buy and then withdraw at any point before exchange without penalty.
attributes.additional_details: Buying and selling houses is such a life changing and costly process it should not be subject to people changing their minds in a whim.  Many families can suffer heartache when a house chain collapses due to a person simply changing their mind.  I propose that before people enter a bid on a house they should get a survey and any searches competed and be in a position to pay a deposit.   This would add an a strong element of security to the house buying and selling process.

attributes.action: Nationalise the M6 Toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is currently underused and is a resource that could be used more effectively under national ownership, this would help save time and money not only to businesses but to local and national economies and also help with air pollution experienced on the M6 which has heavy congestion.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalising the M6 Toll would have numerous benefits from alleviating congestion on the M6 and surrounding roads to helping businesses and local economies of towns that are situated alongside the toll road such as Cannock which is currently having the Mill Green designer outlet village built. 
http://millgreenoutletvillage.co.uk/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35553865
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2015/sep/17/leaving-tackling-air-pollution-to-local-authorities-is-an-inadequate-response

attributes.action: Stop the planned reduction of the tax free dividend from £5k to £2k in April '18
attributes.background: The recent budget the chancellor outlined a reduction in the tax free dividend allowance from £5000 down to £2000. This will hit thousands of small business very hard. As a small business you do not get paid holidays or paid sick leave and small companies already pay corporation tax hitting the SMEs
attributes.additional_details: Chancellors budget 2017. There should be a fairer way to tax the larger companies who pay less corporation tax and take larger dividends. The government want to make this country great again, but you are hitting the backbone of this country the small businesses

attributes.action: Network Rail to restore the 8 hour Quiet Period at night
attributes.background: Train drivers hoot when approaching crossings, to warn people not to cross. In 2016, 4 people were killed on crossings, sadly. Up to 10th December, trackside residents enjoyed 8 hours quiet from 11pm to 7 am. Since then, the Night Time Quiet Period has been cut by two hours, from midnight to 6 am.
attributes.additional_details:
Many residents living close to the 1600 level crossings with 'whistleboards' didn't receive a letter forewarning them of this 'adjustment', as Network Rail underestimated the number of households affected. Eight hours sleep is recommended for adults, more for children. Health is as important as safety. Trackside residents all over Britain are losing sleep, don't leave bedroom windows open at night, and their properties may have lost value as a result of the short Night Time Quiet Period.
References:
Network Rail: Adjustment of the Night Time Quiet Period Dec 2016
Rail Safety and Standards Board: Annual Safety Performance Report 2015/16
Rail Accident Investigations Board

attributes.action: Stop foreign/indirect aid to India & China and redirect the money to the NHS.
attributes.background: Both India and China have active space exploration programs and 2 of the fastest growing economies in the world. Our NHS is in crisis which has recently been described as a humanitarian crisis. This money is desperately needed by our own National Health Service to save British lives.

attributes.action: change child benefit allowance to take into account full household income
attributes.background: To change the rate that child benifit has to be paid back. Currently two people in the same household can recieve 50k a year and claim child benifit, yet if one of the tax payers earns 60k and is the sole earner the whole child benifit needs to be paid back via tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Two people earning 50k a year on a basic tax code would take home £3039.00 each. Total of £6078, plus full child benifit of £1076.40 (one child) £1788.80 (two children). 
Total income for 2 children and salary =£7866.80

Yet if one member of the family is earning £60,000 which is the rate where child benifit is stopped, there total income for their family would be £3522. 

This needs to be looked at.

attributes.action: Intervene in Murdoch's bid to own to take full control of Pay-TV group Sky.
attributes.background: Rupert Murdoch’s 21st Century Fox has formally lodged its £11.7bn bid to take full control of Sky. This will give him control of Sky as well as (Sunday) Times, The Sun and Pay-TV operations in the UK, Germany and Italy. This threatens the plurality of our media and raises public interest concerns.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/dec/15/rupert-murdoch-sky-bid-pay-tv

More information on the issue.

attributes.action: Add gender-neutral name fields to the marriage certificate
attributes.background: This petition proposes that two gender-neutral name fields be added to  the marriage certificate, to replace the father-only field. This suggestion is to enable parity, irrespective of gender/sexual orientation.
attributes.additional_details: In answer to the previous petition that the mother's name be added to the marriage certificate, alongside the father's [https://www.change.org/p/mothers-names-should-be-on-marriage-certificates], the Home Office decided that it cannot agree to adding the mother's name, as that assumes couples have opposite-gender parents, and the idea is therefore exclusionary. Gender-neutral name fields is the obvious solution to this problem.

attributes.action: Bring back the Death Penalty for Murder, Rape and Child Molestation
attributes.background: With the growing murder and rape pandemic, it is necessary to have a deterrent.  Too long the government and judges have trivialised murder, rape and child molestation with poor sentences. The victims have been ignored by many judges and politicians are too quick back the criminals
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the death sentence the nominal must be over the age of 18 and for the that person to have proven beyond all reasonable doubt to have committed the offence of murder, rape or child molestation.   The sentence should be the same regardless of ethnic background or gender and should be law that applies to all people in our country.  The victims are so twice. Firstly, by the perpetrator and and again by the judicial system with the weak sentences they give.  This has to stop.

attributes.action: Take action on the greatest Humanitarian Crisis since 1945
attributes.background:
We must act now
The United Nations have said this week that we are facing the greatest humanitarian crisis since 1945.
20 million people face starvation in Yemen, Somalia, South Sudan & Nigeria. 
Unicef has already warned 1.4m children could starve to death this year.
attributes.additional_details:
Please read this article and watch the video to inform yourself on this urgent issue:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-39238808

We must listen to the United Nations, this is a desperate and dire situation. We are all citizens of this world and have a global responsibility to each other.
We need more funding/ resources to tackle this inadmissible situation.

This is not a political battle, this concerns the lives of millions, whatever your views, we cannot allow starvation to continue.

attributes.action: Continuous blood glucose monitoring for Type 1 diabetics to be funded by NHS
attributes.background:
Insulin dependant diabetics have to fund their own continuos monitoring system.
It has been shown to improve HBA1c (blood sugars) dramatically and reduce diabetic side effects such as Amputation, Blindness and Kidney failure. It should be available to every one not just patients who can afford it!
attributes.additional_details:
It will save money over current methods ie finger prick blood glucose monitoring and reduce diabetic side effects and therefore huge costs to the NHS..

see British Diabetic Association etc

attributes.action: Greyhounds to be muzzled at all times when out in public places
attributes.background: A neighbours cat was mauled to death by two greyhounds. Although the dogs were on leads the owner was unable to control them. It is law in Northern Ireland for greyhounds to be muzzled this needs to be extended to the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Amend prior approval for phone masts to include a minimum distance from houses
attributes.background: There is currently no minimum distance stipulated for masts. They are cautious not to site masts next to playgrounds and schools but are happy to site them next to residential gardens with established play areas. Neighbours should actually be consulted prior to the submission of an application.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous examples across the country of mobile phone companies exploiting the relaxed planning rules by trying to site masts within so called 'breaks in the residential nature of the search area'. If the LPA does not refuse or grant an application for prior approval within 56 days its prior approval is automatically deemed to have been given and the mast can be built even if it is within a few metres of a residential property. The process needs to be far more transparent.

attributes.action: Protect existing noise sources from changes in local population
attributes.background: The village clock chimed for 300 years, but someone moved in from the city and complained. Now it's stopped.  Over population of our small island is creating urban areas to expand and get nearer to existing sound sources, such as race tracks, airfields, and military facilities. Creating conflicts.
attributes.additional_details:
Bell ringing is is dying out due to complaints by people wanting their right to silence, but churches are in inhabited areas meaning conflicts will occur.
If a house is built near a race track, why should the track close when it was there first. 
As long as the noise isn't constant, tolerance should be exercised on both sides. 
The freedom to participate in all legal activities should not be spoiled by the few. And the tradition or existense of something shouldn't be ruined by a new arrival.

attributes.action: Reject all demands from the EU for penalty charges for Brexit.
attributes.background: The EU seeks to protect its income for up to five years by imposing penalties for Brexit, yet there is no written agreement or treaty obligation on us to pay.
